content:
52 chars in bash. Probably duplicate (won't check for an already validated clash). No interest !. 

Can all of you please stop validate anything submitted.
First i do not know a duplicate if there is one post it here. Second bash is not a reference i agree it's not a hard CoC but i think it's okay.

okay for what ... maybe to get your xp  ... but just an if on modulo and sum , it is not interesting ...

bash is not a reference ... but clash should not be made only for python !!!
Morever. I'm waiting for your shortest python code as we are talking about a shortest CoC.

Oh i did not notice that's just shortest changed it. Moreover xp is not interesting for me but it's a normal difficult clash. Clashes are from my point of view for beginners not for pros like you. Just my view.

From my point of view, the worst thing a beginner can do it to do clashes (in particular shortest ones). A beginner should better do puzzles (no stress and more time to ask question if needed). 


Moreover, this particular clash is probably to easy for pros and quite complex for real beginners (need use of loop, modulo,...)

First i did change it to fastest...
Second i think it's good for learning for loops and modulo and this binary stuff and i agree it is too easy for pros

First, changing after validation just because you did not check the mode before is clearly not an excuse. 
Second, my point was that you can not begin under the timer pressure.
Third: this is probably the 100th CoC with binary conversion and this one does not give anything new.

This puzzle is the appropriate difficulty for a shortest-mode clash. The challenge there is to optimize your code (and maybe learn Bash or Ruby or Perl). Just getting a working solution shouldn't take more than a couple of minutes.

If you want a more "interesting" coding challenging, go do Project Euler instead of CoC.

I've just have this one a few minutes ago. Every one answered in less that 2mn ! This clash is just trivial  (even in shortest my 57 char in bash has been found in less that 1mn30s and  without any particular effort to golf). 

Moreover, this is, once again, probably the 100th (ok maybe a little less :D) CoC using the same ingredients (binary, modulo 2 and sum)...

Edit: I've rolled back mode to original shortest only. The fastest mode is just ridiculous here.
Agree that it should only be Shortest.
